meanings.sent1: The senior manager made important decisions for the company.
meanings.sent2: She respected her senior colleagues for their experience.
meanings.sent3: The senior cat in the house always got the best spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The senior member of the team led by example and inspired others.
meanings.sent5: The senior judge's wise words carried weight in the courtroom.

meanings.definition: A person who is older than another
meanings.sent1: My grandfather is a senior in our family.
meanings.sent2: The senior at the retirement home shared stories of the past.
meanings.sent3: The senior at the park challenged the youngsters to a game of chess.
meanings.sent4: The senior in the neighborhood always had a kind word for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The senior in the group guided the younger members with patience and care.

meanings.definition: A student in the final year of high school or college
meanings.sent1: As a senior, she was excited for graduation day.
meanings.sent2: The senior organized the class reunion for their batch.
meanings.sent3: The senior in the school play had the lead role and shone on stage.
meanings.sent4: Being a senior meant having more responsibilities and privileges.
meanings.sent5: The senior student felt a mix of nerves and anticipation for the future.
